page.title: 08Woodleys Farm
page.content: Woodleys Farm looks after 300 acres of land.They own about 200 acres and they rent the other 100 acres off Blenheim. 3 people work on the land regularly.The farm rent machinery like a combine harvester.They only have cows and a few hens.Most of the crops are grass which is made into silage and is used for the cows.The other crop is wheat.There is very little woodland.In the farm there are 4 cottages.The A34 cuts off one field from another.A "B" road cuts off a lot of fields.It is sometimes a lot of trouble,because when they move the cows from one field to another all the cars have to stop to let them pass.The owners of the farm are Mr.and Mrs. Ponsonby.
